intro: Thelypteris marginalis f. elegans, commonly known as the elegant marginal holly fern, is a fern species characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Its leaves are bi- or tri-pinnate, with a slender, graceful appearance that makes it a popular ornamental plant. The fronds are usually evergreen, retaining their color throughout the year, which adds to its aesthetic appeal.
